oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show (Office of Price Stabilization) - Programs 14 & 15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of the Hank Thompson radio show promoted by the Office of Price Stabilization. Labeled as program 14 and program 15. Original broadcast date unknown. Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Wade Wood on fiddle (presumably, not mentioned), Lefty Nason on steel guitar (presumably, not mentioned) and Billy Stewart on bass (presumably, not mentioned).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (00:40) I'll Be Your Sweetheart For a Day (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (03:16) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (04:26) If I Cry (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (06:35) Red Roses Tied In Blue [featuring Johnny Manson vocals] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (08:50) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (09:41) Piano Boogie (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (11:54) Darling, What More can I Do? (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (13:30) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (14:44) Humpty Dumpty Heart (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (15:23) A Broken Heart and a Glass of Beer (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (17:28) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (18:30) How Do You Feel? (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (21:05) Red Roses for Heartaches [featuring Billy Gray vocals] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (23:18) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (24:13) Down Yonder (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (26:05) The Tramp on the Street (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (28:31) Humpty Dumpty Heart (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover]
